issue.title: `generatetoaddress` 2-3x slower on v30 compared to v29
issue.body:
Hardware

```
Darwin Chriss-MacBook-Pro.local 24.6.0 Darwin Kernel Version 24.6.0: Mon Jul 14 11:30:55 PDT 2025; root:xnu-11417.140.69~1/RELEASE_ARM64_T6031 arm64
```


### v29 

```
Bitcoin Core daemon version v29.0.0
Copyright (C) 2009-2025 The Bitcoin Core developers
```

```
$ time bitcoin-cli -regtest generatetoaddress 2000 $(bitcoin-cli -regtest getnewaddress)  
0.01s user 0.01s system 0% cpu 1:56.41 total
```

### v30 

```
Bitcoin Core daemon version v30.0.0
Copyright (C) 2009-2025 The Bitcoin Core developers
```

```
time bitcoin-cli -regtest generatetoaddress 2000 $(bitcoin-cli -regtest getnewaddress)  
0.01s user 0.01s system 0% cpu 4:33.46 total
```

events.body:
I tried the same on Ubuntu / SSD and didn't see a difference.
Just to make sure: Did you start with an empty datadir and fresh wallet each run? (the longer the existing chain is, the slower generating more blocks will be on regtest because `-checkblockindex` is enabled by default there)

I have also measured it a few different ways:

Compiling from source and running it 3 times for `v29.2` vs `v30.30`:
<details>
<summary>generatetoaddress | i9-ssd | x86_64 | Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-9900K CPU @ 3.60GHz | 16 cores | 62Gi RAM</summary>

```bash
VERSIONS="29.2 30.0"; \
BASE_DIR="/mnt/my_storage"; DATA_DIR="$BASE_DIR/BitcoinRegtestData"; LOG_DIR="$BASE_DIR/logs"; \
git fetch origin --tags && \
for v in $VERSIONS; do \
  echo "Building v$v..."; \
  git checkout v$v && \
  rm -rf build-$v && \
  cmake -B build-$v -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo && \
  ninja -C build-$v bitcoind bitcoin-cli || exit 1; \
done && \
echo "generatetoaddress | $(hostname) | $(uname -m) | $(lscpu | grep 'Model name' | head -1 | cut -d: -f2 | xargs) | $(nproc) cores | $(free -h | awk '/^Mem:/{print $2}') RAM" && \
killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 5; \
hyperfine \
  --runs 3 \
  --sort command \
  --export-json "$BASE_DIR/generatetoaddress-compiled-v$(echo $VERSIONS | tr ' ' '-').json" \
  --parameter-list VERSION ${VERSIONS// /,} \
  --prepare "killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 5; rm -rf $DATA_DIR/*; \
             ./build-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoind -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR -daemon -printtoconsole=0; \
             ./build-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR -rpcwait createwallet test >/dev/null" \
  --conclude "cp $DATA_DIR/regtest/debug.log $LOG_DIR/debug-generatetoaddress-compiled-v{VERSION}-$(date +%s).log; \
              ./build-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR stop 2>/dev/null || true; \
              killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 5" \
  "./build-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR generatetoaddress 2000 \$(./build-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR getnewaddress)"

Benchmark 1: ./build-29.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-29.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
  Time (mean ± σ):     27.016 s ±  0.363 s    [User: 0.004 s, System: 0.002 s]
  Range (min … max):   26.726 s … 27.423 s    3 runs

Benchmark 2: ./build-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
  Time (mean ± σ):     44.621 s ±  0.380 s    [User: 0.005 s, System: 0.001 s]
  Range (min … max):   44.191 s … 44.913 s    3 runs
```

</details>

```bash
Relative speed comparison
        1.00          ./build-29.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-29.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
        1.65 ±  0.03  ./build-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
```

which indicated it's indeed 65% slower.

----

Tried it after that with the actual binaries (for a few more versions):

<details>
<summary>generatetoaddress | i9-ssd | x86_64 | Intel(R) Core(TM) i9-9900K CPU @ 3.60GHz | 16 cores | 62Gi RAM</summary>

```bash
VERSIONS="27.2 28.2 29.1 30.0"; \
ARCH="x86_64"; \
BASE_DIR="/mnt/my_storage"; DATA_DIR="$BASE_DIR/BitcoinRegtestData"; LOG_DIR="$BASE_DIR/logs"; BIN_DIR="$BASE_DIR/bitcoin_bins"; \
mkdir -p "$BIN_DIR" "$LOG_DIR" "$DATA_DIR" && \
(echo "Preparing Bitcoin Core versions:"; \
for v in $VERSIONS; do \
  echo -n "v$v: "; \
  TAR="bitcoin-$v-$ARCH-linux-gnu.tar.gz"; \
  URL="https://bitcoincore.org/bin/bitcoin-core-$v/$TAR"; \
  if [ ! -f "$BIN_DIR/$TAR" ]; then echo -n "downloading... "; wget -q -P "$BIN_DIR" "$URL" || exit 1; fi; \
  if [ ! -d "$BIN_DIR/bitcoin-$v" ]; then echo -n "extracting... "; tar -xzf "$BIN_DIR/$TAR" -C "$BIN_DIR" || exit 1; fi; \
  echo "ready"; \
done; echo "") && \
killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 5; \
echo "generatetoaddress | $(hostname) | $(uname -m) | $(lscpu | grep 'Model name' | head -1 | cut -d: -f2 | xargs) | $(nproc) cores | $(free -h | awk '/^Mem:/{print $2}') RAM" && \
hyperfine \
  --runs 3 \
  --sort command \
  --export-json "$BASE_DIR/generatetoaddress-v$(echo $VERSIONS | tr ' ' '-').json" \
  --parameter-list VERSION ${VERSIONS// /,} \
  --prepare "killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 5; rm -rf $DATA_DIR/*; \
             $BIN_DIR/bitcoin-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoind -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR -daemon -printtoconsole=0; \
             $BIN_DIR/bitcoin-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR -rpcwait createwallet test >/dev/null" \
  --conclude "cp $DATA_DIR/regtest/debug.log $LOG_DIR/debug-generatetoaddress-v{VERSION}-$(date +%s).log; \
              $BIN_DIR/bitcoin-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR stop 2>/dev/null || true; \
              killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 5" \
  "$BIN_DIR/bitcoin-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR generatetoaddress 2000 \$($BIN_DIR/bitcoin-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR getnewaddress)"

Preparing Bitcoin Core versions:
v27.2: ready
v28.2: ready
v29.1: ready
v30.0: ready

Benchmark 1: /mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-27.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(/mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-27.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
  Time (mean ± σ):     44.905 s ±  0.570 s    [User: 0.006 s, System: 0.006 s]
  Range (min … max):   44.247 s … 45.259 s    3 runs

Benchmark 2: /mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-28.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(/mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-28.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
  Time (mean ± σ):     39.496 s ±  0.531 s    [User: 0.008 s, System: 0.007 s]
  Range (min … max):   39.087 s … 40.095 s    3 runs

Benchmark 3: /mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-29.1/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(/mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-29.1/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
  Time (mean ± σ):     39.125 s ±  0.801 s    [User: 0.007 s, System: 0.005 s]
  Range (min … max):   38.621 s … 40.049 s    3 runs

Benchmark 4: /mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(/mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
  Time (mean ± σ):     59.629 s ±  0.108 s    [User: 0.005 s, System: 0.007 s]
  Range (min … max):   59.524 s … 59.740 s    3 runs
```

</details>

```bash
Relative speed comparison
        1.15 ±  0.03  /mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-27.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(/mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-27.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
        1.01 ±  0.02  /mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-28.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(/mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-28.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
        1.00          /mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-29.1/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(/mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-29.1/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
        1.52 ±  0.03  /mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(/mnt/my_storage/bitcoin_bins/bitcoin-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/mnt/my_storage/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
```

i.e. v29 is faster than other versions and v30 is indeed 52% slower.

----

Lastly, checked the same on my Mac, which also shows the same:

<details>
<summary>Details</summary>

```bash
VERSIONS="29.2 30.0"; \
BASE_DIR="/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin"; DATA_DIR="$BASE_DIR/BitcoinRegtestData"; \
mkdir -p "$DATA_DIR" && \
git fetch origin --tags && \
for v in $VERSIONS; do \
  echo "Building v$v..."; \
  git checkout v$v && \
  rm -rf build-$v && \
  cmake -B build-$v -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo && \
  ninja -C build-$v bitcoind bitcoin-cli || exit 1; \
done && \
killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 10; \
hyperfine \
  --runs 3 \
  --sort command \
  --parameter-list VERSION ${VERSIONS// /,} \
  --prepare "killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 10; rm -rf $DATA_DIR/*; \
             ./build-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoind -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR -daemon -printtoconsole=0; sleep 8; \
             ./build-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR -rpcwait createwallet test >/dev/null" \
  --conclude "./build-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR stop 2>/dev/null || true; \
              killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 10" \
  "./build-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR generatetoaddress 2000 \$(./build-{VERSION}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR getnewaddress)"

Benchmark 1: ./build-29.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-29.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
  Time (mean ± σ):      4.820 s ±  0.183 s    [User: 0.002 s, System: 0.000 s]
  Range (min … max):    4.665 s …  5.021 s    3 runs

Benchmark 2: ./build-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
  Time (mean ± σ):      7.338 s ±  0.281 s    [User: 0.002 s, System: 0.000 s]
  Range (min … max):    7.145 s …  7.661 s    3 runs
```



</details>

```bash
Relative speed comparison
        1.00          ./build-29.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-29.2/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
        1.52 ±  0.08  ./build-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-30.0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
```

I will do a git bisect to see where it was introduced.

It seems the commit that changed the behavior was https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/7bacabb204b6c34f9545f0b37e2c66296ad2c0de (cc: @achow101)

<details>
<summary>Reproducer</summary>

```bash
COMMITS="9a05b45da60d214cb1e5a50c3d2293b1defc9bb0,7bacabb204b6c34f9545f0b37e2c66296ad2c0de"; \
BASE_DIR="/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin"; \
DATA_DIR="$BASE_DIR/BitcoinRegtestData"; \
mkdir -p "$DATA_DIR" && \
for c in ${COMMITS//,/ }; do \
  git checkout $c && rm -rf build-$c && cmake -B build-$c -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo && ninja -C build-$c bitcoind bitcoin-cli || exit 1; \
done && \
killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 10; \
hyperfine \
  --runs 3 \
  --sort command \
  --parameter-list COMMIT $COMMITS \
  --prepare "killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 10; rm -rf $DATA_DIR/*; \
             ./build-{COMMIT}/bin/bitcoind -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR -daemon -printtoconsole=0; sleep 8; \
             ./build-{COMMIT}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR -rpcwait createwallet test >/dev/null" \
  --conclude "./build-{COMMIT}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR stop 2>/dev/null || true; \
              killall bitcoind 2>/dev/null || true; sleep 10" \
  "./build-{COMMIT}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR generatetoaddress 2000 \$(./build-{COMMIT}/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=$DATA_DIR getnewaddress)"
```

</details>

```
Benchmark 1: ./build-9a05b45da60d214cb1e5a50c3d2293b1defc9bb0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-9a05b45da60d214cb1e5a50c3d2293b1defc9bb0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
  Time (mean ± σ):      4.690 s ±  0.224 s    [User: 0.002 s, System: 0.001 s]
  Range (min … max):    4.434 s …  4.848 s    3 runs
 
Benchmark 2: ./build-7bacabb204b6c34f9545f0b37e2c66296ad2c0de/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-7bacabb204b6c34f9545f0b37e2c66296ad2c0de/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
  Time (mean ± σ):      7.380 s ±  0.410 s    [User: 0.002 s, System: 0.001 s]
  Range (min … max):    7.072 s …  7.846 s    3 runs
 
Relative speed comparison
        1.00          ./build-9a05b45da60d214cb1e5a50c3d2293b1defc9bb0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-9a05b45da60d214cb1e5a50c3d2293b1defc9bb0/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
        1.57 ±  0.12  ./build-7bacabb204b6c34f9545f0b37e2c66296ad2c0de/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData generatetoaddress 2000 $(./build-7bacabb204b6c34f9545f0b37e2c66296ad2c0de/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir=/Users/lorinc/IdeaProjects/bitcoin/BitcoinRegtestData getnewaddress)
```

> It seems the commit that changed the behavior was [7bacabb](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/7bacabb204b6c34f9545f0b37e2c66296ad2c0de)

That doesn't make any sense. That commit doesn't touch anything related to how addresses are generated.
@achow101 But it does touch things related to new blocks being created. Maybe the overhead of wallet writing the best block to the wallet more frequently has an impact here?

> But it does touch things related to new blocks being created. Maybe the overhead of wallet writing the best block to the wallet more frequently has an impact here?

we might want to revive #25297 in that case.

Ah, sorry, misread the issue.

This is expected behavior as a consequence of updating the wallet's best block hash every time a block contains a transaction that belongs to the wallet. What's happening is that we are writing to the wallet for each of these blocks now, whereas previously we were not. I think this behavior is preferred over the previous, even if it is slower.

I've generated a differential flamegraph comparing the commits before and after the regression: and
Flame graphs ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/603d763b-874f-4fb0-ade6-8cffc9f0151c) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cfce6af8-712a-4ab7-bde0-42f90685a09a) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/6e144d18-2be2-4c08-bb58-37ed2fb96d6c) ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2c0f2d57-ed31-4664-abf1-0ceb118c14b7)
Full perf reports [rpc-report-9a05b45da6-1760449923.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22907137/rpc-report-9a05b45da6-1760449923.txt) [rpc-report-7bacabb204-1760450119.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22907138/rpc-report-7bacabb204-1760450119.txt)
Differential flame script ``` COMMITS="9a05b45da60d214cb1e5a50c3d2293b1defc9bb0,7bacabb204b6c34f9545f0b37e2c66296ad2c0de"; \ CC=gcc; CXX=g++; \ BASE=/mnt/my_storage; FG=$BASE/FlameGraph; DATA_DIR="$BASE/BitcoinRegtestData"; LOG_DIR="$BASE/logs"; OUT=$BASE/flamegraphs/rpc-$(date +%s); \ mkdir -p "$OUT" "$LOG_DIR" "$DATA_DIR"; \ export CC CXX; \ flame_prepare(){ commit=$1; \ killall -9 bitcoind 2>/dev/null; killall -9 perf 2>/dev/null; sleep 10; \ git fetch -q origin "$commit" && git checkout -q "$commit" && \ rm -rf build && \ cmake -B build -G Ninja -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RelWithDebInfo \ -DCMAKE_C_FLAGS="-g3 -ggdb -fno-omit-frame-pointer -mno-omit-leaf-frame-pointer" \ -DCMAKE_CXX_FLAGS="-g3 -ggdb -fno-omit-frame-pointer -mno-omit-leaf-frame-pointer" && \ ninja -C build bitcoind bitcoin-cli -j2; }; \ flame_execute(){ tag=${1:0:10}; \ echo 100000 | sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/perf_event_max_sample_rate >/dev/null; \ echo 0 | sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/kptr_restrict >/dev/null; \ echo -1 | sudo tee /proc/sys/kernel/perf_event_paranoid >/dev/null; \ rm -rf "$DATA_DIR"/*; \ build/bin/bitcoind -regtest -datadir="$DATA_DIR" -daemon -printtoconsole=0; sleep 8; \ build/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir="$DATA_DIR" -rpcwait createwallet test >/dev/null; \ BITCOIND_PID=$(pgrep -f "bitcoind.*-regtest.*$DATA_DIR"); \ perf record -F 99 -e cycles -g --call-graph fp -p $BITCOIND_PID -o "$OUT/rpc_$tag.data" -- sleep 60 & \ PERF_PID=$!; \ sleep 2; \ build/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir="$DATA_DIR" generatetoaddress 2000 $(build/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir="$DATA_DIR" getnewaddress) >/dev/null; \ wait $PERF_PID 2>/dev/null || true; \ build/bin/bitcoin-cli -regtest -datadir="$DATA_DIR" stop 2>/dev/null; \ sleep 5; \ perf report --stdio -i "$OUT/rpc_$tag.data" > "$LOG_DIR/rpc-report-$tag-$(date +%s).txt" && \ perf script -i "$OUT/rpc_$tag.data" 2>/dev/null | "$FG/stackcollapse-perf.pl" > "$OUT/rpc_$tag.folded" && \ "$FG/flamegraph.pl" --title "RPC generatetoaddress $tag" "$OUT/rpc_$tag.folded" > "$OUT/rpc_$tag.svg"; }; \ flame_diff(){ first=${1:0:10}; second=${2:0:10}; \ "$FG/difffolded.pl" -n "$OUT/rpc_${first}.folded" "$OUT/rpc_${second}.folded" > "$OUT/rpc_${first}-${second}.folded" && \ "$FG/flamegraph.pl" --title "RPC generatetoaddress $first-$second" --colors hot --negate \ "$OUT/rpc_${first}-${second}.folded" > "$OUT/rpc_${first}-${second}.svg"; }; \ A=${COMMITS%%,*}; B=${COMMITS##*,}; \ flame_prepare $A && flame_execute $A && \ flame_prepare $B && flame_execute $B && \ flame_diff $A $B && flame_diff $B $A; \ echo "RPC flamegraphs at: $OUT" ```

As a side note, why was the `generate` command removed from the RPC interface? It seems like this RPC[ could be useful](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16000#issuecomment-491486488) and avoid the performance hit of touching the wallet?  I'm trying to dig through various PRs and issues and don't see a straight forward answer, perhaps someone knows?  #16000 #17700 #19133 #19455

> As a side note, why was the `generate` command removed from the RPC interface?

Because of the separation between node things and wallet things. `generate` is testing only and there's no good reason to have to add it to the node interface just for a convenience function.

> It seems like this RPChttps://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/16000#issuecomment-491486488 and avoid the performance hit of touching the wallet?

It would not make a difference. The behavior is not because of any repeated access to the wallet but rather because a bunch of blocks are being produced which are relevant to the wallet.

> > As a side note, why was the `generate` command removed from the RPC interface?
> 
> Because of the separation between node things and wallet things. `generate` is testing only and there's no good reason to have to add it to the node interface just for a convenience function.

I think providing helpful testing tools is a worthwhile goal. For instance it was deemed worthwhile to bring back the utility around in `bitcoin-cli` (#19133). Not everyone uses the entire bitcoin core stack for developing their infrastructure (i.e. `bitcoin-cli`), so why not expose these useful utilities to everyone? 🤷‍♂️ . 

>The behavior is not because of any repeated access to the wallet but rather because a bunch of blocks are being produced which are relevant to the wallet.

Yes, so have the `generate` RPC send funds a to an address that are not relevant to the wallet, which avoids the performance issue. I'll be doing this to work around this performance regression, but it would be nice if bitcoin core just did this "out of the box", IMO.

> Yes, so have the `generate` RPC send funds a to an address that are not relevant to the wallet

Well the issues you mentioned are talking about the old `generate` which mined into a wallet.

If you want to mine into a black hole, you can do that with `generatetoaddress` and a random address, or `generatetodescriptor` and `raw(51)`.
